title: Chemical and Biological Warfare
description: History, development, and use of chemical and biological warfare (CBW). Chemical and biological disarmament. Production and destruction of CBW agents. Uses of CBW. CBW terrorism. Ethics of CBW. 2 lectures, 2 seminars. Fulfills GE Area F.
prerequisites: Junior standing, completion of GE Area B, including a chemistry course (CHEM), and a course in biology (BIO, MCRO or ZOO)
